q: Alassane Ouattara was recognised by world leaders as the winner of a Nov. 28 election, but has struggled to get control of the country's finances from incumbent Laurent Gbagbo who has resisted pressure to step down. Ivory Coast has no money to pay any debt at all, Patrick Achi , a spokesman for Alassane Ouattara 's rival government, told Reuters, days before the grace period for the coupon for Ivory Coast's$ 2.3 billion Eurobond due 2032 runs out. missed a$ 29 million

That perception was bolstered two years later when Colin Powell , then chairman of the Joint Chiefs of Staff, declared: I'm running out of enemies. I'm down to Castro and Kim Il Sung. Colin Powell 's observation 20 years ago is still basically true: The United States has no militarily significant rivals, notwithstanding the terrorist threat and the war in Afghanistan.
